intro: Tabernaemontana australis, commonly known as the Australian starflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white, pink, or yellow. The plant has opposite, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Due to its ornamental value, it is also used in horticulture for its beauty and fragrance.
